business.headline: Wasting your credit card reward points? Here's how to track and redeem smartlyMost people use their credit cards daily but forget one key benefit — reward points. These points can fetch you free flights, hotel stays, or cashback, but only if tracked and redeemed wisely. Here's how to make every swipe count.
Sensex ends 130 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; Infosys up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 130.06 points to end at 84,556.40, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 22.80 points to close at 25,891.40.

HUL shares rise nearly 3% after Q2 results and dividend announcementHUL shares have been on a steady uptrend in recent months. Over the last six months, the stock has gained 8.03%, while it has risen 3.81% in the past month and 1.84% in the last five trading sessions.

Is your savings account on tax radar? 7 bank transactions that raise red flagsYour savings account might not be as private as you think. Certain transactions can draw the tax department's attention and trigger scrutiny.

Oil prices surge 3% as India rethinks Russian crude purchases: ReportIndia, which has been the largest buyer of discounted Russian oil since 2022, imported around 1.7 million barrels per day in the first nine months of this year. However, the latest sanctions could now force Indian companies to shift to other suppliers.

Gold and Silver prices today: Check rates, future outlook, key support levelsGold and silver prices fell after record highs as investors booked profits. Easing geopolitical risks, a stronger dollar, and US–India trade optimism weigh, though long-term trends remain bullish.

Bitcoin stuck around $108K. Is the crypto rally fading?Bitcoin, the world's largest and most popular cryptocurrency, has slipped by nearly 1.94% over the past week and was trading around $108,922 at the time of writing. Ethereum, its closest rival, also fell by 3.57% in the same period.
Did Trump get this one right? Report claims India to slash Russian oil buysThe country's top private buyer of Russian oil, plans to significantly cut or completely halt its crude imports from Moscow.

Infosys, HCLTech, TCS: Why are IT stocks rising today?Infosys, HCLTech, and TCS stocks rallied today on the BSE and NSE, driven by India–US trade optimism, Infosys' record buyback, strong Q2 earnings expectations, and renewed investor confidence.

ITR refund still pending? Check your status online and know the reasons for delayWhile many taxpayers have already received their refunds, a few are still waiting for the amount to reach their bank accounts. If you haven't received yours yet, here's how you can track your refund online and find out what might be causing the delay.

Sensex, Nifty hit fresh 52-week highs: Will festive rally continue on Dalal Street?Sensex and Nifty hit fresh 52-week highs, fueled by festive optimism, trade deal hopes, and strong domestic and FII inflows. Key sectors like IT, pharma, and textiles are leading gains.

Gold, silver prices crash: Why are the precious metals under pressure?Gold and silver metals, which hit record highs earlier, have started to decline as investors book profits and shift back to assets such as equities.

Infosys shares rise over 4% today: What's driving the rally?Infosys shares jumped 3.2% to Rs 1,519.75 after announcing a record Rs 18,000 crore buyback. Promoters abstaining boosted investor sentiment, driving IT stock gains and strong market interest today.

Markets heading towards all-time high: Where should you invest now?After weeks of steady growth, benchmark indices are now showing signs of reaching fresh all-time highs, with investors looking for the next big opportunity.

Sensex jumps 800 points: Why is the stock market rising today?Markets rally as Sensex and Nifty climb on trade deal optimism. IT, pharma, textiles lead gains. Will the festive momentum sustain or face volatility? Traders remain watchful.

Sensex, Nifty rise further as reports hint at positive India–US trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 571.48 points to 84,997.82 around 9:25 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading above 26,000. Broader market sentiment also remained upbeat, supported by steady global cues and sustained domestic optimism.

Will Sensex, Nifty touch record highs today amid festive momentum?India's retail industry recorded its biggest-ever festive season sales this year, with Diwali business touching Rs 5.40 lakh crore in goods and Rs 65,000 crore in services.
Will gold and silver prices fall more today after the recent crash?Gold had fallen the most in over a decade on Tuesday, while silver recorded its steepest one-day decline since February 2021.

Compliance norms for edible oil industry tightened, nationwide inspections plannedStakeholders have been urged to complete registration and begin monthly reporting without delay to support a robust, data driven edible oil supply chain.

Criminal angle in Kalyani family feud as police begin inquiry into property fraudIndustrialist Gaurishankar Kalyani and his wife are to be summoned by police for an inquiry into the illegal transfer of ancestral properties by cheating and duping sister Sugandha Hiremath.

entertainment.headline: Kantara Chapter 1 BTS moments: Rishab Shetty shares 'thrill of calling the shots' Rishab Shetty shared behind-the-scenes glimpses of 'Kantara: Chapter 1', highlighting the thrill and challenges of simultaneously directing and acting.

Aneet Padda as Shakti Shalini: Here's why filmmaker Amar Kaushik chose the actor Director Amar Kaushik selected Aneet Padda to play the lead in 'Shalini', following her debut in 'Saiyaara'. The decision aims to inject youth and freshness into the Maddock Horror Comedy Universe's new project.

Tamil composer MC Sabesh dies at 68 in Chennai Composer MC Sabesh, known for the Sabesh-Murali composing duo, died on Thursday at age 68. Sabesh was recognised for his contributions to Tamil cinema as a composer and playback singer.

DDLJ's Pooja Ruparel is Sonakshi's cousin, wore Poonam Sinha's outfit in film DDLJ's Pooja Ruparel, who played Chutki, recently revealed that she is actor Sonakshi Sinha's cousin. The actor shared in a recent interview how her acting journey began and mentioned a memorable connection with Poonam Sinha.

Just Beena things: Rasika Dugal celebrates 5 years of Mirzapur 2, shares video Rasika Dugal celebrated five years of 'Mirzapur 2' by revisiting her fierce portrayal of Beena Tripathi and reflecting on her journey with the iconic series.

Prabhas' The Raja Saab new poster out, first single to drop soon The makers of the much-anticipated film 'The Raja Saab' on Thursday unveiled a new poster to mark actor Prabhas' birthday. The film is set for Sankranthi 2026 release.

BJP's Annamalai applauds Mari Selvaraj's Bison: History beautifully captured BJP leader Annamalai praised director Mari Selvaraj's 'Bison Kaalamaadan' for its emotional depth and social message. The film highlights the journey of Arjuna Award-winning Kabaddi player Manathi Ganesan and the societal challenges faced by rural youth.

Thamma's ending is treat for Stree fans, unleashes the deadliest villain of MDHCU 'Thamma' connects the dots between 'Stree' and 'Bhediya'. Its ending hides a chilling surprise for 'Stree' fans, revealing that the franchise's most feared villain may never have truly died.

Highest praise! Gulshan Devaiah applauded for Kantara by Air India crew at 35k feet Actor Gulshan Devaiah was warmly appreciated by Air India airline crew during a flight for his performance in Kantara: Chapter 1.  This rare gesture of recognition highlights the actor's impact and the film's success.

Kapil Sharma returns with Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2, promises double chaos, laughs Kapil Sharma returns with 'Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2', a comedy sequel filled with matrimonial madness and cultural clashes, releasing on December 12, 2025. The film promises double the laughter with chaotic wedding antics and a fresh dose of humour, as teased by the quirky motion poster.

Chiranjeevi and Venkatesh unite for Anil Ravipudi's Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu Director Anil Ravipudi brings together two of Telugu cinema's biggest stars, Chiranjeevi and Venkatesh, promising a wholesome family entertainer.

Kabzaa director R Chandru sparks debate, says OG scenes resemble his work The 'Kabzaa' director claimed several shots in 'OG' resemble his work during a recent interview, sparking debate on originality.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 45: Fun task falls flat on entertainment The October 23 episode of 'Bigg Boss Telugu 9' promised excitement with the continuation of the 'Street of Wanted People' task, but despite a few funny moments, lack of enthusiasm and team disputes made it one of the dullest episodes this season.

The Monster of Florence review: Italian true-crime whodunit that was never solvedRelease Date:Wed Oct 22, 2025 'The Monster of Florence' explores one of Italy's most infamous unsolved serial murder cases, focusing on the dark social and psychological forces behind the crimes rather than just the killer. With multiple perspectives, the series keeps viewers intrigued while reflecting on human obsession, aggression, and societal pressures.

Jai Shree Krishna: Bill Gates greets Tulsi Virani in new Kyunki promo. Watch Microsoft co-founder and philanthropist Bill Gates is confirmed to appear via video call in an upcoming episode of Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi. A new promo features a conversation between Gates and Smriti Irani's character, Tulsi.
Arjun Kapoor wishes ex Malaika Arora a happy birthday with throwback pic Arjun Kapoor shared a heartfelt birthday wish for Malaika Arora. The two, who dated for years, broke up last year.

Bigg Boss 19: Farrhana Bhatt emerges as an unlikely favourite to win the show Farrhana Bhatt has become the undeniable highlight of 'Bigg Boss 19' with her fearless attitude and unapologetic voice. Despite facing harsh remarks and constant criticism, she continues to own the game, on her terms, without breaking her spirit.

Mari Selvaraj says he prefers dedication over skin colour in casting decisions Director Mari Selvaraj, in an interview, explained his approach to casting, focusing on interest and talent rather than skin colour. He stated that actors are chosen for their commitment and willingness to embody roles.

Exclusive: K-pop group BABYMONSTER on WE GO UP, global love, India bucket list K-pop group BABYMONSTER's second mini-album 'WE GO UP' highlights their bold artistic growth and global fan connection. In an exclusive chat with India Today, the group shares their journey and excitement to perform live in India soon.

general news.headline: Tejashwi it is. Mahagathbandhan names CM face after weeks of wrangling UpdatesBihar elections: The Congress had so far refrained from projecting Tejashwi as the chief ministerial face despite the visible camaraderie between the RJD leader and Rahul Gandhi during the Voter Adhikar Yatra.
Did Trump get this one right? Report claims India to slash Russian oil buysThe country's top private buyer of Russian oil, plans to significantly cut or completely halt its crude imports from Moscow.

Illegal immigrant trucker from India kills 3 in US. High on drugs, didn't brakeA 21-year-old Indian-origin trucker, Jashanpreet Singh, was arrested after he killed three people and injured four others in Ontario, California. Singh, who was under the influence of drugs, reportedly entered the US illegally in 2022. Another trucker who had illegally migrated from Punjab killed three people in a crash in August.

PM Modi's latest post pours cold water on possible meeting with TrumpPM Modi's decision to attend the ASEAN summit virtually means he is unlikely to have another opportunity to meet Donald Trump this year. The Prime Minister has been a regular feature at the annual summit.

Bureaucrat, petrol pump staff slap each other; wife alleges wink, lewd remarkA physical altercation took place between SDM Chhotu Lal Sharma and petrol pump workers in Bhilwara after an alleged incident involving the SDM's wife. The event led to arrests and a police investigation.

The pacer has been hit for back to back big shots by Mitchell Owe. Australia are less than 50 runs away from the target.

Who's paying? Comedian roasts Zohran Mamdani for dining at pricey NYC dinerZohran Mamdani, a self-described democratic socialist, has built a double-digit lead in public polls over poll rival Andrew Cuomo by relentlessly focusing on the cost of living in New York City. He has offered an ambitious agenda that includes freezing rent for millions of New Yorkers and making city bus service free, fuelled by increases in taxes on corporations and the wealthy.

IND vs NZ Live: India in control after Smriti, Pratika fiftiesIND vs NZ live score Women's World Cup 2025: Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal have hit fifties as India have gained full control of the contest in Navi Mumbai. The New Zealand bowling has suddenly looked clueless all of a sudden as the Indian openers are scoring for fun.

Comedian's heartwarming post for Air India air hostess has Internet looking for PreetiComedian Aditi Mittal shared a heartwarming story about an Air India flight attendant named Preeti who comforted her during one of the toughest moments of her life.

Tejashwi Yadav's dare to NDA on Bihar CM face draws BJP's 'thugbandhan' jibeTejashwi Yadav was named the INDIA bloc's chief minister face on Thursday. In response, the BJP launched a blistering attack on the RJD leader, dismissing his promises as "empty rhetoric" and warning that Bihar would not return to the "dark era of Jungle Raj".
Those wanting to buy BMWs...: Amitabh Kant's EV pitch amid Lokpal tender rowThe former Niti Aayog CEO's post comes amid a furore over Lokpal's move to acquire high-end BMW 330 Li vehicles.

What makes Son of Mallah the VIP of RJD-Congress bloc?Mukesh Sahani may lead a small party, but after being named Mahagathbandhan's deputy CM face, he seems to have emerged as the bloc's VIP. The influence of Vikassheel Insaan Party (VIP) over Bihar's marginalised voters makes him a heavyweight in the alliance. Here's why naming Sahani the deputy CM face is smart politics.

Are we ready to talk about sex dolls in India?As AI and hyperreal sex dolls blur the lines between fantasy and fidelity, expert weighs in on how couples can navigate this new frontier of intimacy without losing trust or connection.

Bhopal Diwali horror: 125 injured, many lose eyesight in carbide gun explosionsA cheap Diwali toy turned deadly in Bhopal as carbide guns left scores injured, and several children lost their eyesight. Officials said over 150 cases were reported despite prior warnings.

Drunk passenger causes full drama on Bengaluru-Delhi flight, crew manage chaosA short clip of the incident, shared by Karnataka Portfolio on X, shows passengers buckled in and ready for takeoff when the drunk man began arguing, shouting, and resisting the crew's instructions.

No $100,000 fee for F-1 to H-1B visa status change. Should Indian students relax?US clarification says the $100,000 H-1B visa fee applies only to new petitions filed from abroad. F-1 students inside the US changing to H-1B are mostly exempt from the fee. But amid developments like capped study durations, OPT scrutiny, and reports of campus racism, Indian students face a shrinking window to study and work in the US.

Physical infidelity not a dealbreaker for Twinkle, KJo, Kajol; Janhvi disagreesThe recent episode of 'Two Much with Kajol and Twinkle' sparked a lively debate on fidelity, highlighting generational differences in attitudes towards physical and emotional infidelity. While Khanna and others suggested physical infidelity can be overlooked, Janhvi Kapoor disagreed.

4 most-wanted gangsters of Bihar's Sigma Gang killed in Delhi encounter with copsFour wanted gangsters from Bihar, including notorious criminal Ranjan Pathak, were killed in a joint Delhi-Bihar Police encounter in Rohini.

sports.headline: Women's World Cup: India drop Amanjot, bring in Jemimah for crucial New Zealand clash India women's cricket team have made a key change, bringing Jemimah Rodrigues back into the playing XI for their World Cup match against New Zealand. The decision aims to strengthen batting after recent struggles but has sparked debate among fans and experts.

South Africa warn India with 8-wicket win vs Pakistan, level Test series 1-1 PAK vs SA, 2nd Test: South Africa secured a commanding eight-wicket victory over Pakistan in Rawalpindi to level the Test series. The world Test champions ended a 17-year-wait and gained confidence before their tour to India next month.

Rohit Sharma wins praise for gritty knock despite slowest ODI fifty in 10 years Australia vs India, 2nd ODI: Rohit Sharma struck his slowest ODI fifty in 10 years but earned praise for battling in tough conditions at Adelaide Oval. He was dismissed for 73 off 97 deliveries, while Virat Kohli fell for his second successive duck of the series.

Babar Azam returns to Pakistan T20I squad before World Cup; Rizwan still sidelined Pakistan recalled Babar Azam to T20Is, four months before next year's T20 World Cup. Fans bash Gambhir again after Kuldeep Yadav snubbed from 2nd ODIAUS vs IND: Kuldeep Yadav was once again left out of India's playing XI for the second ODI against Australia in Adelaide, reigniting criticism of head coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill.

Golden Arm Gets New Stripes: Neeraj Chopra Now An Honorary Lieutenant Colonel In Indian ArmyThis special report covers Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra being conferred the honorary rank of Lieutenant Colonel in the Indian Army. The ceremony, held in New Delhi, was attended by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Chief of Army Staff General Upendra Dwivedi. On receiving the honour, Chopra stated, 'This is more than an honour - it is a responsibility towards my country'. The recognition celebrates his exceptional achievements in athletics and his role as an inspiration to the youth. Chopra, who joined the army as a Naib Subedar on August 26, 2016, has been lauded as an icon of perseverance and national pride. This places him in a select group of Indian sports figures, including Abhinav Bindra and MS Dhoni, to receive such an honorary rank in the armed forces.

UCL: Liverpool and Chelsea relish goal-fest, Real Madrid edge JuventusLiverpool and Chelsea returned to winning ways with emphatic 5-1 victories, while Real Madrid continued their perfect Champions League run with a narrow 1-0 win over Juventus.

McGrath applauds world-class Sutherland, Gardner's rescue act against EnglandStand-in captain Tahlia McGrath lauds Sutherland and Gardner's world-class batting in a six-wicket win over England. Their unbeaten 180-run partnership showcased Australia's resilience and depth in the Women's World Cup.

Ashwin explains how Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli can rediscover ODI formAustralia vs India: Former India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin reckons that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli need support, space, open communication, and the right environment to rediscover their best form in ODIs.

French Open: Satwik-Chirag knocked out of men's doubles; Unnati Hooda progressesFrench Open: Chirag Shetty and Satwiksairaj Rankireddy were knocked out of the Super 750 badminton tournament after losing their round of 32 match to Indonesia's Rahmat Hidayat and Muhammad Rian Ardianto on Wednesday. However, rising star Unnati Hooda kept Indian hopes alive by advancing to the pre-quarter-finals.

New Zealand will wear the underdog badge with pride against India: Sophie DevineNew Zealand's Sophie Devine admits that India will come into their upcoming fixture as the favourites. The two sides are set to clash in what will be a virtual quarterfinal clash, with the final ticket to the semis up for grabs.

After Sarfaraz Khan's shock omission, Irfan Pathan urges fans to trust selectorsIrfan Pathan appeals to fans to trust the BCCI selectors despite Sarfaraz Khan's exclusion. The debate raises questions on selection transparency and procedural issues.

IND vs NZ, Navi Mumbai weather forecast: Will rain disrupt crucial clash?Women's World Cup: India will look to end their three-match losing streak when they face New Zealand in Navi Mumbai, in a contest threatened by rain, with forecasts predicting "rain or thundershowers" later in the evening or night.

Will BCCI push for Mohsin Naqvi to be impeached as ACC chairman?The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) reportedly have majority support but are unlikely to push for the impeachment of Asian Cricket Council (ACC) chief Mohsin Naqvi, aiming to avoid further tensions with Pakistan ahead of India hosting the T20 World Cup in 2026.

Can Virat Kohli rekindle the magic in one last dance at Adelaide Oval?Australia vs India, 2nd ODI: Adelaide has celebrated Kohli's triumphs, but the story isn't over. One last innings at his beloved Oval could be the statement that confirms the hunger still burns, with the 2027 World Cup the prize he's aiming to conquer.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
